page.title: 02Houses
page.content: {Houses} are built on foundations made from concrete. Most houses are built with {bricks} but {tiles, stones and flints} are sometimes used for decoration. There is mortar between the bricks to keep them apart. The {roofs} are usually sloping but can be flat. They are covered with {felt, then slates, tiles or sometimes thatch.} On the roof there are chimneys with special pots for the smoke or fumes to escape. There are gutters along the roof edge to carry rainwater to the down pipe and drain. Most houses have a garden but these are often small to allow more houses to be built at less cost. Houses are usually cuboid in shape being divided internally to give {seperate rooms for dining, relaxing, sleeping, cooking and caring for personal hygiene.} Rectagular glass windows and electric lights are used.
